text: Joseph Erlanger (5 January, 1874- 5 December, 1965) was an American physiologist. He won the 1944 Nobel Prize in Physiology or Medicine, along with Herbert Spencer Gasser, for discovering that different nerve fibres have different functions. He was of Jewish descent.Nobelprize.org ==References== Category:1874 births Category:1965 deaths Category:American Nobel Prize winners Category:American physicians Category:Jewish American academics Category:Jewish American scientists Category:Jewish Nobel Prize winners Category:Johns Hopkins University alumni Category:American neuroscientists Category:Scientists from San Francisco Category:American physiologists Category:Educators from San Francisco
title: Joseph Erlanger
